channel.title: I've never understood this. May someone clarify for me?
channel.description:
I have never understood this type of math equation in programming. May someone break it up and explain what each section does? (Spoonfeed) ;)
[code=java]Integer.parseInt(token2) <= 0 ? 3210 : Integer.parseInt(token2)[/code]

item.title: I've never understood this. May someone clarify for me?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:1, topic:530605”]I have never understood this type of math equation in programming. May someone break it up and explain what each section does? (Spoonfeed)

It is the ternary expression, it is the equivalent to an if-else clause for variable use (in a nut shell)

if (Integer.parseInt(token2) <= 0) { someInt = 3210; } else { someInt = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

is the same as writing:

someInt = Integer.parseInt(token2) <= 0 ? 3210 : Integer.parseInt(token2);

If you need more examples feel free to ask.

Read full topic
item.source: I've never understood this. May someone clarify for me?

item.title: I've never understood this. May someone clarify for me?

item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

The question mark and colon is the ternary operator.

This page has an easily understood example and explanation of it.
